title: STEM-Based Rubber-Powered Car Project for Exploring Quadrilaterals and Triangles

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic geometric elements (points, lines, planes, angles) and the ability to use simple measurement tools
context.additional_context: Concurrent data collection and visualization activities using personal devices (tablets/smartphones)

learning_goals: Learners can analyze the structure of real-world objects (e.g., rubber-powered cars) and classify properties of quadrilaterals (rectangles, trapezoids) and triangles.
Learners can propose design improvements for vehicle travel distance and stability by applying properties of quadrilaterals and triangles (sides, angles, symmetry).
Learners can solve everyday problems (e.g., optimal parking space design) by applying area and perimeter calculations for quadrilaterals and triangles.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
